text: Bottled 1 pt 6 fl oz on January 30, 2017, thanks to monmisreal!Clear dark brown color, small white head. Spicy, sweet, a bit fruity scent. Spicy, malty, fruity taste. Spicy aftertaste, kong dry and lasting. Medium full mouthfeel, medium bitterness. Warming alcohol.

On tap at Cajun Café on the Bayou, Pinellas Park, Florida. Brownish amber, almost clear, with very little head. Light cinnamon, yerba mate, some sarsaparilla in the aroma. Unbelievably sweet taste. Some squash-y vegetal notes with a touch of allspice. Medium to long cloying finish. Well done for what it is but far too sweet for me.

650 ml. Deep copper-brown body has a light haze. Sizzling soda pop head disappears immediately. Nose is allspice and cinnamon. Taste is overpowering spice from the get-go. The only saving graces are a hint of pumpkin-squash flavor and a bit of dark roast flavor. Later the finish develops some pleasant cherry and almost tobacco notes. Medium-heavy body is out of balance with the sweet-earthy spices dominating. A nice touch of alcohol warmth. Quality ingredients show, but this is basically a spice bomb, with little evidence of pumpkin. Struggled to put down 6-8 ounces, and will have to blend the remainder in small doses with other brews to even finish the bottle.
Bottle from my father, bought in Florida. Spicy smell with cinnamon, a bit christmasy. Similar taste with some alcoholic warmth in the finish. Sweet. A bit too boozy.
Poured from a bottle. Purplish cloudy appearance, no lacing or head. Amazing cinnamon spice aroma, smooth, fruity and refreshing.

Sample at GABF 2016. High creamy lasting off-white head. Clear dark amber body. Cinnamon pumpkin herbal and spicy aroma and flavor with little hops bitterness, low carbonation and a long finish. Well balanced.
Tap at cigar city, tampa. Amber color, smooth white head. Aroma has sweet fruity notes, spices, cinnamon, some pumpkin. Smooth body, spices, pumpkin, suryp notes. Good for christmas.

Thanks Dchmela! This is fantastic! Pours a brownish orange. Aromas of pumpkin, apple, cinnamon, vanilla. Flavours are malty pumpkin, vanilla, bubblegum, fall spices. Fantastic. Not too sweet and easily one of the best pumpkin beers Ive had.
Lucky draft at Fishale because they thought the keg was blown. Top shelf pumpkin beer with huge flavors. Lots of pumpkin, maple syrup sweetness and bold spice. Good and not over the top.
Fat på CBC 2016. Smak och doft av karamell, marsipan, russin, plommon, trä, farinsocker, trä, pumpa, kanel och vanilj. Rund och len, kryddig, bra balans, fin sötma och beska.Mmm!
From tap. Dark amber colour with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of spice, caramel, malt, pumpkin, vanilla, cinnamon and a sweet finish.
Bottle. Pours a dark amber color with minimal tan head. Softly carbonated. Mostly spicy aroma of cinnamon and nutmeg. Bold sweet pumpkin flavor with spices. Full bodied and very tasty.

2015 BJCP Category: 30B Autumn Seasonal Beer (base style: ?)
AROMA: Strong potpourri aromas of cinnamon and nutmeg especially; sweet pumpkin puree. Sweet brown malt presence as well. 11/12APPEARANCE: Burnished copper hue; hazy body with CO2 visible. Small, tan foam completely dissipates. 1/3FLAVOR: Robust palette throughout. Pumpkin bread up front with sweet brown maltiness. Transitions to spicy on the second half with strong cinnamon, clove, and nutmeg flavors. Vanilla seems to linger in the background likely due to alcohol presence. 18/20MOUTHFEEL: Full bodied; low carbonation gives it a thick, chewy, almost syrupy viscosity. Some minor alcohol warmth complements the palette. Finishes remarkably clean. Not quite a sipper. 3/5OVERALL IMPRESSION: Delicious beer to be sure; one of the best pumpkin brews ever made. This would be perfect if it held a head and wasnt quite as syrupy. 9/10TOTAL SCORE: 43/50DISCLAIMER: The author is not a certified BJCP judge; therefore, this score sheet is not necessarily indicative of proper BJCP judging techniques and protocol. The author is grading to 2015 BJCP Guidelines in order to prepare for examination.

22oz bottle. 8/11/16 bottle date. Appearance: Brown with a deep amber hue, clear, with a light khaki foam head. 
Aroma: Nice pumpkin spice heavier on the allspice, nutmeg and clove, with a light cinnamon and vanilla. Light caramel. Very nice
Taste: Surprisingly sweet maltiness, a touch of bread crust, then turning to a allspice and nutmeg forward pumpkin spicing. Cinnamon is restrained. Moderate bitterness to balance the intense malt sweetness and spicing. Comes across like a pumpkin spiced piece of toast. 
Mouthfeel: Medium bodied with a low to moderate carbonation. No noticeable alcohol warmth. 
Finish: Toasted malt stand out, with some nutmeg and allspice. 
Overall: A really well done pumpkin ale that nicely balances the maltiness, spicing, and high ABV. Nice toasted and caramel malt backbone and spicing heavier on allspice and nutmeg, compared to the cinnamon bombs of some pumpkin ales. Alcohol well hidden for its strength.

Lots of spice. Some malt. Some bread. Dark opaque amber with a thin foamy light tan head that leaves a film of foam on the surface and a coating on the glass. Vegetal. Lots of pumpkin. Perfect level of spice. So much pumpkin. Smooth. Sweet. Velvety. A hint of bitterness on the finish and just a smidgen of booziness at the back of the throat.
Sample @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016 Blue session 20160513. Sweet, spicy and caramely, vanilla, bourbon, cinnamon, coconut. The finish is sweet with bourbon.
On tap at CBC 2016. Dark caramel with a tan head. Tons of cinnamon, caramel, vanilla and toasted coconut.
Sample @ CBC-16, Copenhagen 13/5-15. A lot coconut, also vanilla. Some notes of raisins. Coconut in finish.

Bottle. Pours clear burnt umber, small beige head, decent lacing. Aroma is spiced pumpkin, cinnamon, brown sugar. Flavor is medium sweet, light bitter, squash, yams, nutmeg, all spice, cinnamon. Medium body, low carbonation.

Yep, a pumpkin beer found its way into the Boise Imperial Stout Tasting. Golden orange pour with a light fluffy khaki head. Nose is bright pumpkin pie spice and a little vanilla. Tastes sweet and moderately spiced. Cinnamon and nutmeg of course. Enough body and sweetness that its not a spice burn nor artificial tasting. Well done pumpkin brew.

22oz bottle thanks to Steve. pours out a golden topped with a sand head. Nose is great big pumpkin pie spice a nice light sweetness. Taste is more of the nice pumpkin pie spice nutmeg and some allspice.
22 ounce bottle. Pours a dark brownish orange with a nice khaki head. Aroma of spice and pumpkin. Taste is cinnamon, nutmeg, clove, and pumpkin. One of the best pumpkin beers.

Poured a cloudy dark copper color with about a 2 inch khaki creamy head. The head dropped to a clingy film in a few minutes. The aroma was full of fall. A good hit of nutmeg, pumpkin pie spices, caramel malt, cinnamon and ginger snaps. The beer had a thick creamy texture. There is a nice malt backbone with all the flavors to match the aromas. Good pumpkin pie spice flavor, nutmeng, cinnamon and towards the finish a light bitterness of ginger snaps. All the aromas & flavors of Thanksgiving in a bottle. As a side note I had this about a month ago at The Icehouse in Punta Gorda, Fl. It was on a nitro tap and you had the option to get the rim coated with cinnamon sugar. The nitro made the beer more creamy. I tried it with and without the cinnamon sugar rim. The coated rim made it more of a dessert beer. Great either way.

Pours a very hazy and very dark copper/burnt orange color that spears almost chestnut brown in the glass with dark orange edges and a two finger, off-white head that quickly settles into a thick, lasting ring. Sporadic streaks and spots of soapy lacing left behind. 

Spicy, autumnal aroma with lots of sweet pumpkin along with tons of earthy, zesty spice. Smells like an aggressively spiced pumpkin pie puréed into a glass. Has a similar dessert-like quality as Pumking with more malt and complex spice profile and less sweetness. Hints of roasted pumpkin, pumpkin pie filling, nutmeg and vanilla along with clove, ginger, coriander, cinnamon, brown sugar and allspice. Sweet caramel malts underneath with hints of toffee, tobacco and leather. The spice profile is very musty, earthy and is a nice counter to the sweeter pumpkin pie characteristics. One of the better smelling pumpkin beers that Ive had. 

Full bodied for the style with a nice balance of pumpkin pie sweetness and earthy, zesty spice notes. Strong organic tasting pumpkin and pumpkin purée/pie filling up front with prominent nutmeg, vanilla, brown sugar and allspice countered by a more musty, rustic spice profile that has hints of peppery clove, ginger, cinnamon and cardamom. Theres a nice malt backbone giving off more sweetness with hints of caramel, toffee, toast and biscuit. Slight boozy sweetness in the finish but there is no heat at all. Drinks incredibly well for 8.5%. In addition to the complexity, there is incredible balance. The spice presence is really strong taming the pumpkin pie/dessert sweetness and theres just enough sweet malt and pumpkin character preventing it from feeling overwhelmingly spicy. I can see how this could be a bit too much for some but I think its a great take on the style. One of the better examples of what a pumpkin beer can be.

Sampled on nitro at Pint and Brew in Tampa area. I will preface this review by saying that I really do not enjoy pumpkin beers...at all. That being said, I really like this beer for what it is. Everything is very much in balance - the pumpkin, pumpkin pie spice, sweetness, and body. What really impressed me the most was the decision to nitrogenate it. I loved how creamy and smooth it was. I am still not a fan of the style, but I think its the best pumpkin beer Ive ever had.
sample from a 22 on sunday. Nice straight up with lots of pumpkin flavor and a little bit of spice. Good body to hold up against the fruit. Decent sweetness and still a big good desert beer.
Pours a dark golden amber with fluffy head. Aromas of dark fruits, spice, and cinnamon. Flavors of pumpkin, caramel, all spice, nutmeg.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2016 Update: drank in bottle. This is completely different. Change rating from 4 to 3.5. nose is so overwhelming. Really hard to drink but I must confess Im not a pumpkin ale guy. 
Old rating:
Nitro... On tap at The Royal Pig. Aroma: loads of nutmeg, cinnamonand pumpkins. App: hazy orange with huge frothy head due to nitro. Taste and palate: medium creamy body, loads of nutmeg again, medium sweetness but not overwhelming. Overall: great. I?m sure the nitro helped quite a lot but I didn?t think that the sweetness was too much even though it?s really sweet.
Originally sampled at GABF. Now on nitro at brewery. The spice profile of this beer is exceptional. Orange color and creamy head. Excellent body and a good gourd flavor.

Pours clear dark orange with a medium off white head. Head retention is ok. AROMA: pumpkin, sweet potato, cinnamon, all spice, malt, brown sugar, slight molasses, roasty, herbal hops, caramel, coffee, alcohol, cooked vegetables, spices, slight salt and smoke. TASTE: malty, pumpkin, cinnamon, allspice, slight mint, herbs, brown sugar, molasses, roasted, caramel, slight coffee bitterness, alcohol, smoke, cooked vegetables, hop spice and leaves. AFTER TASTE: cinnamon, hop spice, malty, caramel and alcohol with an oily finish.
Bottle at tasting. Light brown pour. Aroma of strong pumpkin and spices, mostly cinnamon. Taste has lots of pumpkin as well, with cinnamon, anise, caramel and mild pepper. Very nice.

Growler from brewery. Looks like molasses. Overly sweet. Sticks to your mouth. Standard pumpkin spices but over the top. My biggest prob with this beer is price. Was on sales at $20 for 32oz. Seriously not worth half that cost

Cloudy orange, almost brown pout with a single finger head that fades quick. Aroma of all spice and a little pumpkin. Medium mouth. Taste has hints of pumpkin and an odd artificial sweetness. Some strong alcohol notes as well. Cinnamon and nutmeg are just really odd here. No lace.

Pours a clear caramel with a thin film on top that leaves no lacing. Nose is of nutmeg, allspice and pumpkin pie. Taste is moderately sweet and loaded with nutmeg, cinnamon and caramel. Swilly for sure but still pretty well made. Both body and carbonation were moderate and mouthfeel is sticky. Some alcohol but nothing bad. Overall it wasnt the best choice for basking in the sun but I found it to be still pretty good. A pumpkin beer a year is more than enough, though.

How: Bottle (22 oz). Shared at Mont-Carmel tasting. 

>>> A cloying nutmeg bomb with too much spices, sweetness and alcohol. 

-  Clear orangey amber with a medium bubbly beige head and little lacing. 
-  Nutmeg is really intense and overpowering everything else. 
-  Its rather sweet as well which, combined with the intense spiciness, is the perfect recipee for a cloying beer. 
-  If it wasnt enough already, the beer is also boozy. 
-  The pumpkin character isnt super fun either, its borderline rotten. 
-  Its not horrible for a pumpkin beer, but its still not something I could drink more than 2 oz. Im sure a Bud Lime Pumpk-A-Rita would be easier to drink.

Flavors:  Nutmeg (massive dose), cinnamon, caramel, pumpkin, cloves, alcohol.

pours unclear copper-red with a small off-white cap, some retention and lacing. nutmeg and cinnamon explosion, massive masala dose, apple caramel pie, red fruitiness - rotten pumpkin meat, toffee, pepper, woodsy tannins, spirit - rum; some sweetness - demerara, peppery toffee; spices. light carbonation, medium body - oily; sweet, boozy and über-spicy nutmeg finish. blah.
Bottle shared. Clear deep copper pour with disappearing head. Aroma is super cloying nutmeg, disgustingly spicy, caramel, bready notes. Taste is super spicy, undrinkable. Easy drainpour.

CCB nails it again with this one. Perfectly balanced the pumpkin with the spices for a delicious flavor and aroma. Taste is a lot like a sweet pumpkin pie at grandma's house. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at CCB tasting room. Appearance is a clear, dark orange with a rather subdues off white head, which dissipates rapidly leaving minimal lacing. Taste is sweet pumpkin pie, nutmeg and cinnamon. This is my favorite pumpkin beer.
Hazy orange pour with light white head. Aroma is cinnamon and nutmeg. Taste is sweet pumpkin pie and a mild sour. Very nice.

Draft. Slightly hazy burgundy with a finger of silky tan head that deposits a bit of thin lacing. Aroma of a just- opened pumpkin pie filling. Sweet pumpkin purée, apple, cinnamon, nutmeg, maple, plus splashes of vanilla and toast. The flavor is almost like mulled apple cider in spice character. Tons of cinnamon; lots of clove; roasted pumpkin. Lingering toast with a touch of caramel. Alcohol flavor is in there as well. Medium body, mild massaging carbonation. Smooth alcohol heat in the nose. One of the best pumpkin beers ever. Complex, slightly sweet and delightfully spicy.

From notes. Finally found the long-lost notebook from the 4 Elf Party at Dark Horse on December 13! So, thats where this was found. Shared by someone as I was wandering around the line making friends. The pour is a darker brown with a lint of lighter amber in there somewhere. Not a true brown. There is an off white head that just leaves a couple soapy spots on the glass. The aroma is typical pumpkin beer. Heavy on the cinnamon and allspice. This one has a little more pumpkin and marshmallow going on with a decent graham cracker crust. I like the aroma on this more than I like most pumpkin beers. The flavor is very similar. There is a nice toffee addition on the flavor, and thats about the only addition. The mouth feel is pretty decent. Its not as thick as I would like it to be, and the carbonation is just light. The aftertaste is lingeringly spicy and then rolling though a surprising sweetness. Not too bad
Smell is super nice pumpkin pie. Taste is pumpkin with fall spices, but its not really sweet like pumpkin pie.
Pours a nice dark amber, orangish-red color with off-white head. Pumpkin, pumpkin pie spice, and caramel and malt on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes like a nice piece of pumpkin pie.
Sampled at an ESBLS tasting. It poured a brown color with a tan head. The aroma was of pumpkin, cinnamon and caramel. The taste was similar to the aroma with some booziness. Good stuff.

Sampled at ESBLS. Reddish brown. Pumpkin pie spices with pumpkin aroma. Nice. To me the best pumpkin beers taste like pumpkin pie and this one excels. Alcohol on the exhale. Just a little hops under and they really arent needed. I like this.

From tap. Pours murky orange with a small to fully gone head. Aroma is vanilla and mild citric fruity. Biscuity, cinnamon and caramelish. Dry, wooden and slight spiced flavoured. Bitter and slight herbal finish.
22 oz bottle. Deep copper with an average off-white head. Aroma is of pumpkin, citrus, florals, toffee, cinnamon, and ginger. Taste is of pumpkin, herbs, cinnamon, ginger, and toffee.

Bottle. The look is clear, reddish ok colored, and a light eggshell colored head. The smell is pumpkin, spiced, nutmeg, pie, and good. The taste is pie, spices, nutmeg, cinnamon, crust, and good gourd.

Draught @ All In Beer Fest 2014. Pours deep brownish golden with a small goldenish offwhite head that leaves a small trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is vegetal and spicy with graham crackers, pumpkin gourds, pie crust, hay, allspice, cinnamon, caramel and hints of pecan nuts. Taste is sweet, vegetal and spicy with caramel, toffee, pie crust, pumpkin, allspice, cinnamon, nutmeg, hay, soil and lemon zest. Mouthfeel is round, tiny spicy astringent and medium bodied. Finish is sweet, slightly bitter, vegetal and spicy with caramel, pie crust, pumpkin, allspice, cinnamon, soil, hay and lemon zest. Nicely balanced. Usually not a huge fan of spicy pumpkin beers but this one is good.
UPDATED: APR 5, 2015 Not bad for a spiced beer. Has the rough makings of a promising one. The flavors seem to mask that the beer itself wasn?t perfect. The levels of flavor are a bit flat. Tap
Poured amber with white head. Aroma of clove, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice. Taste is sweet, spicy, and smooth. I can feel some swedish apple / cinnamon-pie.

Draught at the AIBF 2014 session no 3 cons 2014-11-15
AR: pumpkin meat, species - cinnamoon, cloves etc
AP: orange amber, transparent wee head
F: cinnamoon, pumpkin meat - no this is not good dont like pumpkin beers put like to try everything from this brewery

On tap at aibf2014. Hazy orange with white head. Smell is sweet caramel, spices and pumpkin. Taste is caramel malty with fruit, pumpkin and spices. Big body with some warming alcohol. Semi dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.

Poured from a tap. Medium brown color, nice creamy white head. Mild sour aroma. Medium body with a creamy malt and pumpkin flavor and a smooth finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle share at a buddys house last night. 
This was poured into a tulip. 
The appearance was a nice looking hazy brown color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipated within less than a minute leaving some slight lacing sliding into the beer.
The smell had a really maple-ly sweet maltiness running over top of some bready and spiced pumpkin notes. Light vanilla slightly runs in and out. 
The taste was mainly sweet through the maple and allowing a gentle pumpkin pie - esque vanilla to come through.
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with a fairly decent sessionability about it. The carbonation hit my tongue nicely - good for the style and for me. 
Overall, I say this was a pretty good pumpkin ale with a nice dose of maple added. Id bang it again.

22 oz. bomber from Homer321. It pours a hazy amber color with a disappearing orange head. The aroma is surprisingly fruity with notes of baked apples, pear, molasses and of course, nicely balanced cinnamon, clove and allspice. The flavor is pretty much the same. More baked apples, cinnamon, clove, nutmeg, touches of caramel and molasses with a fairly spicy, bitter finish. The body is very full, but not oppressive. The spices are definitely used well and not overdone. I also liked the baked apple aspect of this one. A nice one for a cool, fall evening.

Pint bottle from local liquor store orlando. Pours dark orange with no head. Aroma is spice- cinnamon, clove, pumpkin. Flavour is sweet pumpkin, caramel malts, cinnamon, cloves. Although very sweet it is really well balanced. Low carbonation. Good body. These beers are usually a miss but this one is very good.

The aroma and the flavor really said "Werthers Butterscotch". It was diacetyl, but good diacetyl. Clear bronze. Spice was subtle and not aggressive at all, and this may have been one of the best pumpkin brews of all time. Slippery mouthfeel. On tap, Proof Production Facility on an incredibly clear Tallahassee fall day.
Very good and solid pumpkin beer. Spices in the aroma are not over done and the flavor is just right.

Draft. Nose of vanilla, light graham cracker, cinnamon, and pumpkin. Pour is dark red, medium off white head. Taste is initially sweet and sugary, lots of crackery goodness, with a soft, subtle pumpkin influence. Very nice.

Like pumpkin pie and a dollop of vanilla ice cream. The spices are noticeable but not overwhelming. There are definite vanilla notes on the palate but you can taste the pumpkin more than most. Real nice.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2016 THIS is what pumpkin beers should aspire to be. THIS is what i wanted from Pumking! Dark hazy orange pour. Good God this smells nice. Spices yes, but theres something unique in there as well. You can taste and smell the natural pumpkin as much as the spices, which are done just right. That would be good enough, but the added ridiculous creaminess in the flavor and feel as you swallow, making this as a whole like creamy thick liquified pumpkin pie a-la-mode, gives this the nod as THE best pumpkin beer Ive ever had...and itll be hard to ever top."
2016 still among the best of the year, but not quite as magical as in years past.  Maybe 4.2 just for the single vintage.  Overall fluctuates between 4.4 and 4.5.

From notes. Tasted on 6/30/12 at the 1st Annual Chimipalooza, from a 750mL bottle courtesy rustyham. Pours hazy burnt orange with a thin white head that completely disappears. The nose is full of pumpkin baking spice, cinnamon, cardamom, clove, nutmeg, and plenty of caramel malt. The flavor is just like a pumpkin pie that has too much cinnamon, and the caramel malt. The body is full with light carbonation and a long spiced finish.

Bomber to snifter (shared with the Mrs; thanks newcigarz). Looks good for the style; a fairly transparent darker amberish brown with foamy off-white head. Smells of pumpkin, cinnamon, and mild clove and nutmeg. Tastes like it smells with a fuller but smooth mouthfeel. A good pumpkin ale.
(Backlog) Draft at blind tiger for eyedrinkales birthday 9/14/2011. Brown hazy pour with tan head. Spice, pumpkin, cinnamon, vanilla aromas. Very strong vanilla, pumpkin and spice flavors.

I love pumpkin pie and I adore pumpkin beer, and this might be the best one. The thick pour and rich aroma caught me right away. The pumpkin really sticks with you throughout and its smoothness cant be exaggerated.

Vertical Tasting of 2011, 2012, 2013; Thanks to PaulUnwin for providing me with the ability to do this tasting -- All of these beers are great pumpkin beers. The 2011 is the most subtle, perhaps the spices have mellowed to give it the most "blended" flavor. The 2012 has a great pumpkin, brown sugar, carmel flavor. Really great. The 2013 is by far the brightest beer with the spices shining through very nicely. 2012 was the concensus favorite by me and my buddies that tried this. All together these beers were all nicely done.

"Horizontal" Tasting: Cigar City Good Gourd Imperial Pumpkin Ale (GG), Cigar City Good Gourd Almighty (ALM) and Cigar City Brewpub Gourds of Thunder (GoT), via Hopscotch, thanks buddy!  APP: (GG) Muddy coppery brown, fading head, minimal lace (3). (ALM) Slightly darker, longer lasting head and better lacing (4), (GoT) Unlike the others as it is a black ale (I did not know that until I poured it), quickly fading head and almost no lace (2) NOSE: (GG) The expected pumpkin pie spices readily available along with good caramel and herbal esters (8). (ALM) Boozy barrel vapours along with lots of sweet malts. Oaky and sort of leathery too. Hint of an oncoming infection, sourness and lactic acidic roams about (6). (GoT) Roast, charred wood, leather, light spices and honestly underwhelming. (5) A clear win for the more traditional Good Gourd Impy.  TASTE:  (GG) Much like the aroma, the taste is quite as expected. Sweet malts, light pumpkin flesh and a good amount of spices but not too much. Light alcohol presence along with some finishing earthiness. Quite enjoyable (8). (ALM) Much like the aroma, lots of barrel influence, quite noticeable rum and oak notes. Spice are there too add roundness but it seems a tad flushed out. Does taste far better than it smells (7). (GoT) Much like the aroma it is heavy on the roast, nutty and charred character with faint spices and little to no squash notes. Some dirty earthy coffee tones as well... and just like the aroma it is underwhelming on the palate( 6). Yet another victory for the more traditional brew!  Mouth Feel The GG is just where I expected, smooth and slick, right amount of heft (4). The ALM is sharper and still oily, yeah I like this palate slightly better (5). More disappointment for the GoT, ashy and thin, minimal carbonation makes it worse (1).  OVERALL:  A clear win for the straight forward Good Gourd Imperial Pumpkin Ale (15) over the rum barreled GG Almighty (14) and the distant inbred cousin Gourd of Thunder (9) which before this I would have figured would have been my favorite but alas was a huge letdown.

Bottle from trade. Pours a slightly murky amber brown with a scant off white head. Smells like pumpkin bread theres cinnamon, nutmeg, molasses, candied sugar. Taste follows nose, this is good homemade pumpkin bread in a glass.

Bottle shared, poured into a tulip. Pours a dark caramel/honey orange brown with off-white head. Smells of pumpkin, squash, cinnamon and spices. Tastes of pumpkin, cinnamon, spices, caramel, light vanilla. Medium body, semi-dry finish.

Full disclosure, if you had told me Cigar City was making a pumpkin beer, I would have been my house that it would be a train wreck. If I had done that, I would be homeless. 750ml bottle pours a clear copper amber with some white head. Nose of chai tea, vanilla, a little cardamom, nutmeg. Flavor is very sweet, roasted sweet potato with marshmellow, vanilla, chai. Finishes sweet with some spice. Really good.

Bottle, thanks Adam! Gusher... wasnt expecting an overflowing bottle from a pumpkin ale. Head quickly settles to a cloudy orange/tan color. Very well defined aroma of brown sugar, spices, cloves, and all spice. Lively mouthfeel, medium body, a very slightly sweet and spicy finish with a earthy bitter aftertaste. Some earthy undertones come across as a slight bitterness. Certainly different from almost every pumpkin beer Ive had.

Bottle shared at the 8th Richmond Industry Gathering, 12/1/13. Pours a clear amber color with a thin frothy head. Aroma of pumpkin, earth, spice, vanilla. The taste is pumpkin, spice, vanilla. Tart finish. Medium bodied, lingering spice.

bottled: 20AUG11

A: pours an autumnal orange with really no head production and only some sheeted off-white bubbles. Hazy with spotty lace.

S: cloves, nutmeg, yams, sweet

T: Sweet malts with plenty of spices. Just what you would expect. Nothing really special here, I guess its what people are after in a pumpkin.

M: Medium body with slight carbonation, it is nice with a slightly dry finish.

O: Well, this taste pretty much like pumking to me. I can tell its high quality, but Im still not on board pumpkin beer should be anything but a stout.

Serving type: bottle

09-29-2011

Bottle fromTotal Wine Naples. Pours brown with a brown head. Doesnt leave any lacing. Low on carbonization. Nice, rich pumlkin notes on the nose. Finally a pumpkin beer that actually smells like pumpkin. Big pumpkin of the tongue as well. Truly fantastic!

Bottle - Wow! Aroma is pumpkin pie, heavy on the cinnamon side. The taste is pure pumpkin, though, which is nice. Starts sweets and leans sour as it warms. Very balanced between sweet and sour. Very nice!

Bottle, 11/12/2013. Pours dark ruby brown, clear, thin white head dies to swirl on the surface. Aroma is pumpkin pie, nutmeg and cinnamon, vanilla and sweet fruit cake toffee character, holiday spices. Taste is dark pumpkin bread,moderately sweet, cinnamon and nutmeg, clove, spicy finish with mild bitterness. Medium heavy body, concentrated and smooth. Dont normally go for pumpkin beers, but pretty decent.

Hazy amber in color... Aroma of cinnamon, spices and punch to the face of vanilla... Flavor is vanilla, caramel, toffee, sticky mouthfeel, pumpkin spices intense on the palate... Amazing, very thick... Great beer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This fall I had my first Good Gourd as my first beer for a tailgate; after most of the pumpkin hype season had died down. I poured it into a red wine glass (my best option) and immediately noticed that I liked the color and aroma much more than certain other pumpkin ales. My first sip, I was hooked. I bought up several more, two for this winter, and a few to age for next year. I picked the first one up for $13, and the next few for $14; and they were certainly worth the price IMHO.

750mL bottle, 2012 variety consumed Halloween. I find this to have more of a mulled spice character which is quite nice, its not drying or quenching in the amount of spice and certainly has some pumpkin flavor. Quite tasty.

Bottle, split with two of my best friends. This beers #300 rating. Poured a nice, smooth amber color with a medium sized slightly off-white head. Aroma was notes of light pumpkin pie, vanilla. Spices are there, but they are not overpowering. This has a much more natural note of pumpkin itself, as opposed to a overly spiced beer. Flavor was divine. This was like eating a fresh slice of pumpkin pie. Well balanced spices bring out the wonderful flavor of pumpkin itself. Very smooth, and the alcohol is pretty well hidden in this one. Highly drinkable, and perhaps my favorite (out of market) pumpkin beer to date.
2013 and 2012 bottles. Poured amber with white head. Aroma of clove, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice. Taste is sweet, spicy, and smooth. 2013 has fuller mouthfeel. Otherwise, all the same and tasty.

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2013 From a trade with tampaheel-thanks, brother! Gotta say I dont generally like pumpkin beers and not a fan on pumpkin pie, but (rating this objectively) this stuff is liquid pumpkin pie. They just nailed it. Walks the right line of not being too sweet and incredible spice. Amazingly well done if its your thing, its not mine, but respect.  If it was my thing it would be: 9/3/9/3/18

Dark amber beer out of the bottle with a foamy tan head. Nose of pumpkin pie and Yankee candle. Tons of cinnamon, clove, ginger, orange peel and apple cider. Pumpkin pie finish and noticeable alcohol. Very flavorful spice beer.

A: Deep Orange/Amber Hue, Passes Little Light, Thick Off White Head, Good Lacing

S: Yams, Cinnamon, Nutmeg

T: Pumpkin, Sweet Potato, Allspice, Cinnamon, Clove

M: Heavily Carbonated, Light to Medium Bodied, Clean, Crisp, Mildly Sweet

Overall, a really good pumpkin ale with more of a focus on the pumpkin flavor than being over spiced. A great beer.

Disclaimer...I typically do not like Pumpkin beers. (I do like pumpkin pie which is weird I know.) 750ml bottle at the Sybarite Pig in Boca Raton, FL. Snifter. Pours a dark brown with a hint of amber. Thick white-tan head. Good lacing. Man it sure smells like mas punkin pie baking. Aroma is spot on with pumpkin, bread, cinnamon, all spice and nutmeg. The taste is also very close. I almost thought about taking some and warming up but thought it would destroy it. Probably one of the best pumpkin beers Ive had. Full body, smooth finish with the all spice just cranking away on the tongue.

This may be as close as I come to loving a pumpkin beer. Aroma was dead on pumpkin pie filling. Somehow on top of all the typical pumpkin spices (cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice), there is some vanilla, and graham. A little thick and warming. Very sweet. I would not want more than an 8oz pour of this but I would like some whipped cream on top.

750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours amber/brown with a lacy, beige head. Aroma of a good amount of pumpkin and spices that are balanced well by the good amount of caramel and toffee malts plus a light doughiness. Flavor the same with a good blend. Average to smooth texture. One of the best pumpkin beers.

Bottle. The pour is a light copper. The aroma is all pumpkin, smells like fall. The taste continues that. Tons of fall spice and basically tastes like a pumpkin pie. Nailed a fall beer for sure. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle is light amber, smells like a delicious sweet potato pie. But it is way too sweet, why is this sold in a bomber?!
750ml bottle thanks to Tim. Pours a hazy orange with a large tan head. Big pumpkin and nutmeg aroma. Taste is amazing just like a pumpkin pie. Very great pumpkin beer.
Pours red-amber with a small off white head. Aroma is pumpkin, pumpkin spices and molasses. Taste is sweet potato (not pumpkin) pie with some heavy cane sweetness. The finish falls off at the end.

(bottle - 750 ml) Clear amber pour with an off-white head. Big pumpkin pie spice aroma at the start with some sweetness underneath. Flavor is like liquid pumpkin pie mixed with some vanilla ice cream. Creamy and smooth with each individual spice getting a chance to say hello without being overpowering. The clove presence is really nice. Probably the best pumpkin beer Ive ever had.
bottle from daniel719, many thanks. pours amber with a cream colored head. nose of light spice, pumpkin. taste is like fresh pumpkin pie, crust and all. super official. moar please.

Bottle--my wife, who is not a beer drinker, declared it smooth. Looks perfect, dark amber, copper color with a medium head. The aroma is all spice with clove, no annoying cinnamon noted. No pumpkin noted in the taste, more of a brown ale with spices. Warming finish. Produce place.
750ml to snifter. Orange amber pour. Pumpkin and spice on the nose. Nice pumpkin flavor. Very sweet like pie and some definite spiciness on the finish.

Pours a hazy, dark honey amber color with a gigantic light tan head giving off an orangish hue. Marzen, pumpkin, and cinnamon nose. Smooth and moderately thick, sticky mouthfeel. Becomes sweeter as the beer progresses in the palate. Pumpkin pie flavors to the hilt. Also, a bit of flavor somewhere between Coke and root beer. Finishes with some needed bitterness.  I appreciate the non-gimmickiness of this beer.  The flavors convey genuine ingredients.

Bottle from MeadMe, thanks again!
Sweet caramel and brown sugar malty with a healthy does of pie spices. Its not the worst pumpkin beer Ive ever had and it actually grew on me quite a bit.

Pours an orange-amber with a off-white head that has decent retention. 

Aroma: Pumpkin nose with malt taking a background role. Hints of spicing; certainly not overdone. 

Promising aroma is not followed by good taste. There is a nice bit of pumpkin/squash flavor, but it is surrounded by a rather unpleasant earthy gourd flavor. 

Medium body with moderate carbonation.
(from 2011 notes)

Tap @ CCB Tampa Airport... Poured deep orange with a beige head. Nice lacing. No, I didnt add the shot of Fireball to drop in my pour like the bartender suggested. Squash purée and spices in the nose. Great autumn spicing made this a delicious treat. Full bodied, moderate carbonation. And lots of sugars on this one. Finished with a pumpkin pie note.

Excellent pumpkin beer. Heavily spiced but not overly so. Comes in at the end rather than front loaded. Allows you a time to actually get the pumpkin. ABV is hidden pretty well. Not a huge fan of pumpkin beers but this is really good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: pumpkin, spice, and everything nice. seriously, pumpkin, clove, and a soft cinnamon note throughout. Call me crazy, but together, all of these things are reminiscent of freshly steamed sweet tamales. Amazing. Appearance: copper red. creamy white head. Taste: pumpkin, clove, cinnamon. Palate: thin, lively, finishes long and sweet.
Bottle gift from SJ. This brew had a nice pumpkin Flavor that tasted like real pumpkin. A nice blend of cinnamon , spice and nutmeg. Very Good.

Bottle shared by Chaney. Thank you Brandon.

The beer is copper to amber hued with a quarter inch of off white head. Crimson highlights in the body. The aroma brings cinnamon, pumpkin pie, pie filling, sugar, while cream. Sweet and spicy with a smooth malty body. A touch of alcohol warmth in the finish. Really solid. Splitting the bottle a few ways is probably best.

Hazy orange pour. Big off-white head with a good bit if lacing. Nice aroma of a pumpkin pie with minimal spicing. Closer to sweet potato pie. Taste is pretty much the same. Awesome beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

What a great beer for the season! Cinnamon spice and every thing nice. Wish it was available year round

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a good light brown with hints of red a nice one finger khaki head, Smells of booze, pumpkin, cinnamon and caramel. The best way to describe this is that it taste exactly like pumpkin pie even the crust! and then the finish is a lot of booze, there is no hiding the alcohol in this beer.

ours a golden caramel color with thin white head. Aroma is pumpkin, spice, nutmeg, cream. Flavor is much of the same with some stronger pumpkin and spice notes, heavy cream flavors, slightly boozey. Generally medium body with a pleasing herb/spice finish. This was an amazing pumpkin beer and likely the best that I have had.

Pours a deep amber color with a fluffy head. Aroma is like fall in a glass! Lots of cloves, cinnamon, malty sweetness. The taste is full of spice. Obviously since the pumpkin is not a strong flavored vegetable it does not impart a whole lot of flavor and is easily masked by the spices, but I didnt mind. Its a great pumpkin ale and easily one the best out there.

Pumpkin season! Bottle. pour dark orange. two finger head. Aroma - an unfortunate abundance of spice (cinnamon, nutmeg, cream?) that seems to overpower the pumpkin. Appearance- a mix of cherry red and pumpkin orange. This beer tastes like a pumpkin pie, cinnamon, nutmeg, and clove.

Bottle purchased at the brewpub. Pours a deep dark reddish orange with a nice fluffy off white head with a slightly orange hue. Aroma of cinnamon and nutmeg, maybe some sweet vanilla, and some faint pumpkin, sweet sugar, and some booze when I take a big whiff. Sweet pumpkin flavor and some cinnamon and clove spice. Lingering sweet vanilla cream and pumpkin is definite a highlight here. Finishes nice, medium carbonation. Would be even better if it werent 105 with the humidity outside. Neat beer even for non pumpkin beer fans.

2012 Good Gourd Tap at CCB for El Catador Members. Pour dark golden brown with little head. Smell just like a pumpkin pie. taste Pumpkin at the front and lingers nice on the tounge. Mild to little bitter from the hops, cinnamon, vanilla, cloves and nutmeg. This is my favorite pumpkin beer!
Bottle. Cloudy copper with a thin beige head. Aroma: pumpkin, biscuit, cinnamon. Taste: biscuit, spice, mild pumpkin. Thick creamy body. Very good pumpkin ale.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange with paperthin white head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is spice, pumpkin, and cinnamon. Medium mouthfeel with nutmeg, spice, clove, and cinnamon flavors with nice spicy finish. hides alcohol well, a very good pumpkin ale from Cigar City.

Mmmm, love this stuff. Spicy, malty, mature aroma. Smells like gingerbread!

Highly refined for a pumpkin beer. Smooth, crisp, spicy, mildly sweet for a bit, pumpkin flesh. One of the very best pumpkin beers out there.

Cloudy brown with a short, off-white head.
Aroma is clove, cinnamon, pumpkin, bread,
Very sweet and natural pumpkin and crust flavour.
Light, despite the rich essence....chilled pumpkin pie with cool-whip topping...
Not very beery....but damn tasty....one of the finest Pumpkin Ales Ive ever tasted.

bomber to glass.  recd in trade from codysjb.  Plenty of spice - pumpkin/fall spices in armoa. maybe pumpkin couldnt tell.  nice lighter orange pour.  me.d palate.  Taste - waaaaay  to sweet.  didnt finish the bomber.  just overly cloyingly sweet with some spice.  not nearly in neighborhood of wey or ST pumpking.  thanks cody!
Amazing! Gives an aroma of spice and cinnamon. Nutmeg and corriander are the first thing that I taste. A little vegetable at the end.
Bottle.  Nutmeg, cinnamon, clove, and pumpkin aroma.  Golden yellow with small head.  Sweet clove, cinnamon, pumpkin, and malt flavor with lightly bitter herbal finish.  Intense flavors.

Bottle courtesy of changeup45. Strong nutmeg, cinnamon, and pumpkin/ banana aroma.  Smells almost identical to banana nut bread.  Hazy amber with a small ivory head. Pumpkin malt and lots of cinnamon and clove flavor.  Medium to full body, soft carbonation. The spice in this one overpowers the pumpkin.

Bottle at fletchfighters tasting. Thanks guys! Pours a hazy orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma is malty with pumpkin and spices. Taste is medium sweet and spicy leading to a mild bitter and spicy finish. Not usually a fan of pumpkin beers but this one is pretty good.

750ml bottle, shared with Callipalegic. Hazy red / orange color. Minimal off-white head. Few loose dots of lace. Good pumpkin pie and spice nose. Bigger body. Light, crisp carbonation. Good light bitter, spice taste. Just a little bite. Unique pumpkin aroma - a bit of a thicker body, more big pumpkin flavor makes this a pretty tasty treat, especially in January, outside of the thick of the craze of the pumpkin season. I think the mouthfeel could use some work, though. Would probably be very nice if barrel-aged

My bottle [750ml] shared with HogTownHarry, GregClow, jerc & mabel. Pours a deep orange-peach with a massive long-lasting rocky beige head. Nice aroma of pumpkin along with some spices, fruit, yeast and malt. Flavour is malty with a good amount of pumpkin, spices, some cream abd a touch of sweetness. Medium bodied. Bottle was a bit old (it was a gusher) but it was still quite good.

Bottle at ChrisO tasting, thanks to Henrik, 30/12/12.
Hazed dark amber/brown with a thin tan head that dissipates to the edge.
Nose carries sugars, spice, sweet fruits, light booze, nutmeg.
Taste comprises sweet candied sugars, ripe fruits, spice, clove, dark orange, dates, figgy jammyness.
Full end of medium bodied with soft carbonation leading to a sweet finish with a modicum of booze. 
Good stuff - ideal for a tasting !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Tasting at Chriso's. Spice bomb! Cinnamon, allspice, cloves and nutmeg all in evidence, completely drowning out any beer-like flavours. A totally over the top beer, but in a sort of nice way.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[5017-20121217] 750mL bottle. Fruity apple soap aroma infused with harvest spices. Murky, orange brown body with a long-lasting creamy off-white head and a ginormous gushing head on opening. Apple pumpkin fruit flavour has a yeasty vodka tang. Medium body. Interesting -- its probably infected but not in a bad way. That being said, I cant stand it as it warms up. (6/3/7-/3/13) 3.2
(c/o blankboy, w/ him, GregClow, HogTownHarry, jercraigs)

Bottle at Chisos tasting 30/12/12. Hazy orange brown with a big white head. Big Perfumy nose, which reminds me of a bath bomb. Nutmeg and cinamon. Solventy, sweet. Very viscous srypy with moderate carbonation. The beer is pretty unbalanced and the mlat character is dominated by OTT spices.

2012-12-17. Very hazy dark orange body, massive gushering beige head. 3+ Musty lightly funky aroma, dusty malt, pumpkiny fruit character, mild melange of spices. 7++ Flavour is similar, musty funky overtones, modest spice and pumpkiny fruit, modest bitterness in the finish. Average bodied palate is very carbonated. I am curious if it is a bit off or if this is how it is intended, but it was fairly enjoyable either way. Bottle shared by Blankboy

Bottle at Chrisos tasting in London, 121230. Somewhat hazy golden beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Pumpkin aroma, sweetish, cookie dough, loads of spices, malty, chocolate. Pumpkin flavor, loads of spices again, malty, cookie dough, biscuits, floral notes. Good but maybe a bit too spicy.

Bottle shared at The Kernel, London - many thanks to The Peter. Pours clear, dark gold with a creamy, off-white head. Unreal aroma, loaded with carrot cake. Big sweet  flavor, more carrot cake, rich bread, toasty sugars. Medium to full bodied with fine to average carbonation. Sweet finish, lightly warming, lightly dry, with more carrot cake, deep sugars. Beautiful nose, and very decent flavor. A sweet beer but a wonderful sipper.

750ml bottle shared by blankboy with me, gregclow, jercraigs & mabel.  HUGE gusher, hazy orange-amber, huge fluffy  beige head.  Smells - pretty nice:  sharply yeasty, spices for days, nice pumkin malt, alcohol - frankly if this is infected, its still nice (7+).  Taste - alcohol, floral bitterness, pumpkin spice, a bit sharp and dry - again, maybe infected, but nice.  Average body, sharply carbonated, a little acidic, finishes dry and a bit boozy ... nice.

Bottle @ The Kernel. Many thanks to thepeter for sharing this! The pours a deep amber with a large off-white head. The aromas of bold cinnamon, allspice, brown sugar sweetness. Rich, spicy aromas. The taste is much the same. Meaty spiced pumpkin, loads of brown sugar and cinnamon. Medium body, a bit hot and sweet. Overall, while sweet, this is quite flavorful. Not bad!

750 ml bottle

Thanks to tastybeer for sharing one more beer before we called it a night. The highlight of the evening, this was a pretty robust pumpkin ale with a bug body. Much like other Cigar City beers it is above average and on par with some of the Elysian specials.

Aroma / Appearance - A nice one finger bubbly head rises like yeasty dough. The ruby base looks like cooked squash drained into a glass. Nutmeg, cloves, cinnamon, and pumpkin give it the festive autumnal texture you would expect. Graham crackers finish off a big nose.

Flavor / Palate - Spices, cinnamon, apple pie, and graham crackers fill one with the components of a Thanksgiving dessert buffet. Sweet pumpkin pie with a generous dollop of whipped cream completes the feeling of a liquid feast. If I have a complaint it might be borderline too sweet (close to Pumking). Fortunately it doesnt fall over that cliff into mediocrity.

Bottle at a Ratebeer "sticky floor" tasting, Den Haag. Poured a reddish colour with a glass hugging white head. The aroma is massively pumpkin and some more pumpkin. The flavour is rich with pumpkin all the way through with some spice and sweetness in the palate. Nice to taste, but only in small quantities.

Bottle shared at Deans sticky floor tasting.  Pours clear amber with a ring tan head.  Aroma of pumpkin, cinnamon, cloves and nutmeg.  Flavour is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter.  Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle at Deans sticky floor tasting. Slightly unclear red color, virtually no head. Smells like some kind of candles my girlfriend likes. Really weird. Tastes like that as well, not that I know that taste but its weird, spices or herbs and just not what I like. Low body, low carbonation.
Bottle @ sticky floor tasting. Aroma is huge sweet spicy cinnamon sinterklaas and speculaas madness. Flavour is pretty sweet speculaas spices, thick malt caramel. Too sweet and cloying for me.

bottle shared at a Ratebeer meeting at ABCBeers in the Hague.
Thin white head.  Clear amber pour.  Spicy after taste.  Nice brew

Pours amber almost brown and hazy. Spice aroma. Pumpkin and spice taste. Decent carbonation and mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Orange pour, off-white head, some retention/no lace. Aroma of pumpkin, big clove, spice, nutmeg, cinnamon. Taste is very sweet, lots of clove, pumpkin, spice. Palate is soft, slick, sweet finish. Good.

750mL bottle.  Light brown color.  Tan foam.  Aroma of high-end spices.  Allspice, cinnamon.  Soft textured, light fizz.  Flavors of squash, nutmeg, light cinnamon, mild bitterness.  Well balanced.  Well worth the hunt.  (3535)
cinnamon spice aroma.  tastes like pumpkin pie.  almost too sweet for me.  very interesting.

750ml bottle I picked up while in FL. Pours clear golden orange with small white head. Aromas of pumpki, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves. Flavors of pumpkin, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and nice amount of brown sugar like sweetness. This was pretty damn impressive for a pumpkin beer, which is not my favorite style.

750ml bottle .. . pours a deep orange .. great foam .. . light hay, spices, and pumpkin pie.. . chewy mouth, mild finish .. . this was quality!! .. my new favourite pumpkin beer! ....good gourd man!!!
Pumpkin, cinnamon spices and caramelly sweet malt . More aggressive flavor and body than most of the pumpkin beers I have tried so far.

Pours clear orange with a small light tan head. Smells extremely of pumpkin. Taste is primarily pumpkin with a touch of cinnamon. Medium-bodied with a slick texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Cigar City Good Gourd Imperial Pumpkin Ale finishes with a bold pumpkin flavor.

Bottle shared at La Muerta release. Ive had 24 hours to contemplate this and believe that Good Gourd is my favorite pumpkin beer. Pumpkin pie spice aroma, light amber color.  Taste is perfectly balanced flavor of spice, pumpkin, and the base beer.  Exceptionally well blended flavors.  Great mouthfeel.  Beautiful beer.

From a 750ml bottle. An awesome combination of pumpkin, spices  and beer that belies its 8+% abv.  Very smooth pumpkin ale that you can taste all portions of a pumpkin pie from the spices to the pumpkin itself.  A classic.

This poured a darker amber color with a biege head.  Aroma was lots and lots of cinnamon and vanilla, light pie notes too.  flavor was fairly sweet, almost too much, with cinnamon rolls and pumpkin flesh meled together.  Solid for the style.
Bottle @ Ulfborg. Murky orange body with a huge offwhite head. Aroma and flavor is very spicy and pumpkins.
Its bright orange and smells and tastes of pumpkin pie. The spices are very well chosen and make this very much like the real thing. Not as hearty as Pumpking.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2013 October 19, 2012 tap from the brewery.  Cloudy copper pour with limited head.  Aroma was spice, sweet, cinnamon and pumpkin.  Taste was just like a pumpkin pie.  I am typically not a pumpkin beer fan, but this was well done.
Had this at the 2012 Great American Beer Fest in Denver, Colorado. Nice big spice profile, awesome pumpkin/gourd flavor.

Hazy orange coloured body with a light copper glow and a thin, one centimetre tall tan head. Aroma of pumpkin pie spice, nutmeg, allspice, cloves, aniseed and a bit of licorice candy with a good caramel note. Medium-bodied; Assertive malty flavour with a ton of caramel and toffee sweetness going on and a little kick of spice at the end, but not overly powering. Aftertaste shows some good caramelised sugars, some pungent yeast and malt notes and a lot of spices lingering on the palate. Overall, a good pumpkin spiced beer, but not an amazing  beer, just simply a reliable beer that is another stellar choice from the brewery. I sampled this 75 cL bottle purchased from New Beer Distributors in New York, New York on 02-July-2012 for US$17.00 sampled at home with grandparents of our newly born girl, eating stuffed pumpkin at home in Washington on 18-October-2012. It wasnt a cheap beer, but im sure it wasnt cheap in Florida and obviously even more in new york. Perhaps worth a splurge, but there are definitely other better beers for much cheaper.

In short: A typical spicy pumpkin ale, a bit toasted and a bit on the sweet side.  Decent if you like the style
How: Bottle 750ml.  Consumed when approximately 8 months of age.  Bottle from fat ass GodOfThunder
The look: Cloudy dark amber body topped by medium beige head leaving good lacings on the glass
In long: Nose is typical pumpkin beer spices (cinnamon, nutmeg, etc.) over a sweet pastry.  Taste is very sweet (not surprising from CCB) and with a sweetness that feels like pure sugars more than rich maltiness.  Body feel rather airy and fluffy, full of yeast, low on malts but somehow high on sugars.  Like crunched melba toasts in a yeast soup and a lot of toasted sugars.  Quite spicy and this helps to hide the sweetness.  Ive never been a fan of the unofficial style of spicy pumpkin ales, and this beer is not going to change that fact.  Average for this pseudo-style I guess.  My wife liked it a lot more than I did but she has the worst taste in beer and in men.

Clear dark orange, thin white head that disappears. Nose is pumpkin pie,  field pumpkins. Taste is spiced pumpkin pie, vanilla, nutmeg, cloves. medium bodied. Only complaint is that with more body it would be even better.

Pours orangey amber color. Big spicy pumpkin nose. Lots of nutmeg, cinnamon, vanilla and pumpkin flavors. My favorite pumpkin beer hands down. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sampled at GABF. Pumpkin accents the beer as a whole, and its spicy like a pumpkin beer but nice overall with bigger flavor.

750mL bottle, sent from Gillard (thanks Ryan), pours a dark orangey brown with a small beige head. Aroma of pumpkin pie, nutmeg, cinnamon and a little more spicy than something like Pumking. Flavour of cream soda, loads of it, and loads of pumpkin spices, cinnamon and nutmeg, finishing sweetish on the cream soda. Quite heavy-bodied and fairly sweet, but not cloying. However, the cream soda qualities become more and more pronounced the more you drink, making it rather unpleasant. Not the best and very overrated I feel.

Bottle shared at the UFC tasting. Thanks guys! Poured from a 750 ml bottle into my Deschutes snifter.

A: Pours a very solid orange with some darker hues intertwined. Splotchy lace followed the beer down the glass.

S: Big pumpkin. Very pure in nature, definitely the best pure pumpkin smell Ive got from a pumpkin ale. Light cinnamon and some pie crust were also present.

T: The pumpkin is integrated very well with the spice and neither dominates. The pure pumpkin is nicely woven with the cinnamon and slight hint of nutmeg as well. This is laid nicely on a pie crust backbone that is leaning towards the sweet side.

M: Light bodied, very drinkable. Nice sweetness is left on the palate. Nice carbonation.

O: This is definitely the best pumpkin beer Ive had to date. The pumpkin was purest in this one and nicely integrated in with the spices.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-09-2011

Nose is pumpkin spice, nutmeg, little bit of cinnamon. Taste is the same pumpkin nutmeg cinnamon, really easy to drink in my opinion, not a full bodied beer that Im used to from cigar city. Really drinkable though, I like it.
vanilla sweetness, light body, good spice mix - not overpowering, becomes a little cloying right at the end of the entire bottle but still pretty manageable.

Delicious pumpkin ale! It reminds me of childhood Thanksgivings. Very sweet, cinnamon aroma, thin head but that wasnt needed to smell this beer. Color is a light brown. Full of flavor and rich in spices, I pick up the pumpkin and cinnamon right away and finish with some nutmeg. I loved it!

Aroma is full of non-overpowering spice with a candy sugar edge. Appetizing. Poured a light brown with a thick off white head. Oily on top. Taste has pumpkin, nutmeg, and again candy sugar sweetness, but not too sweet. Good amount of carbonation, but more might carry the subtle flavors farther.
heavy on the pumpkin and nutmeg, this pumpkin is squarely in the pie category. its got a bit of tang in the background, but its a solid entry in the pumpkin beer world. one of their better i think.

A great twist.  Using the pumpkin in the madh perfects that big mouthfeel one would expext from a cigar city beer.  Only issue is an overuse of the connamon as it is slightly numbing and overpowering after the firstsip.  Would love to taste this on lemon or the cedar wood though.

750 ml bottle thanks to Hefeweizenhunny. Got to say this is a different take on a pumpkin. Nose and taste is very similar. Vanilla, all spice, roasted pumpkin with a decent cookie/ dough element. Palate is nicely balanced, no spice is real dominate. Blended flavors. Creamy texture. This is a fine Fall, pumpkin brew. Among my tops in style.

Supplied by Airforcehops--thanks! Pours a clear copper-tone rust color with a smallish off-white head not even a fingernail in length. Smells straightaway of Cloves cigarettes, pumpkin spices, orgasms, fried cinnamon, pear skins, and french toast. Tastes of cough suppressant, cream soda, vanilla bean, toasted breadcrumbs and pumpkin seeds. I dont know how I feel about it.
Thanks Airforcehops and gf. Light clear orange appearance. No head. Brown sugar scent. Nutmeg and duh pumpkin. Sort of a lactose taste. Vanilla. And pumpkin. Little boozy. Heavy body.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2012 Light copper and beige head. Pretty clear. Cinnamon, apple pie, raisins, brown sugar. Unfortunately also tastes like cinnamon. Bit astringent. Disappoints overall. (On tap at the brewery)

By far the best pumpkin ale I have tasted.  Nose is incredible.  Well balanced.  Cherry on the nose and palate.  Finish lingers on pleasantly. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pours amber head fades super fast. Smells and tastes of cinnamon nutmeg gram cracker sweet such a great taste mix spice and sweet. Where most pumpkin beers Taste like spicey candels this ones right there with Pumking awesome.

Holy Cow, this is a beer I have been waiting to drink since I heard about it last year.  Hug Thanks to Hopscotch.  This beer is amazing.  beautiful red color with a tan head that went away quickly.  Smell is nutmeg, spices and punpkin.  The taste is very spicy with nutmeg and pumpkin .  Light carbination with a sweetness that maybe caramel.  But this is an awesome beer for sure.  I wish it was colder outside but who cares.  This beer would be ideal on a cool Oct night or halloween.  Thanks Eric
amber orange color, aroma of pumpkin, bread, spices, flavors of pumpkin, bread, caramel, cinnamon, nutmeg, not a big fan of pumpkin beers but this one is very good
Aroma of pumpkin pie, sweet graham cracker and brown sugar. After drinking for a whole, the flavor comes in pretty subtle and just becomes a nice sweet brown ale with a creamy malty body.
One of the best seasonal beers Ive had in a while. Very cider like and the spices come through on the palate. Even the dregs are great.

Pours a hazy copper orange with a thin off-white head. Aroma of pumpkin, cinnamon, nutmeg and caramel. Rich and smooth flavor of pumpkin pie, cinnamon, nutmeg, graham cracker, caramel and other spices.    A great pumpkin beer

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2012 Wow. This stuff is magic. I mean literally feels like a pumpkin pie liquid complete with graham cracker crust and whipped cream. How they manage to not make it ridiculously sweet and balance it with excellent pumpkin spices is beyond me. But the mouthfeel is the biggest amazement...creamy, perfectly creamy. Just a great beer all around. Lucky to get to try one this autumn.
Tap.  Amazing aroma.  Pumpkin, cinnamon, nutmeg.  Tastes great too.  Just like quality pumpkin pie.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2012 Great pumpkin beer. Strong on aroma, and full on flavor. Finish is almost like candied pumpkin, a bit too sweet. I will definitely have another before they are gone for the year. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Total Wine. Its not even September and I cant help myself from already sampling the new Fall beers. Pours orange-tinged amber with minimal head. Obvious spices on the nose. Flavors are very present but clean as well, without being overbearing. Cinnamon, cardamom, squash, subtle pumpkin seed, bread loaf   Nutmeg and cinnamon roundly linger in the mouth long after a sip is enjoyed. Im a big fan of pumpkin beers and I may have just discovered a new favorite.

Bottle.

Delish.  I am a bit of a Cigar City prick, but this seasonal is phenomenal.  Sweet, so it is not for everyone, but this brew is a perfect pumpkin.  Southern Tier Pumpkin has a similar pallet, but this takes the cake....or should I say pie.  Get it where you can and enjoy it where you will.

One of the best, if not the best, pumpkin beer I have ever had. Well selected spices enhance the pumpkin flavor and add to a full bodied beauty. Smooth, creamy, well balanced and surprisingly well hidden alcohol. You can tell a lot of care was put into this one.
Bottle @ Danish Summer Gathering Ulfborg, 2012. Pours hazy orange with a fluffy white head. Cinnamon, spice and yeast. One dimensional. Medium bodied.
Drank from a 22oz. bottle. Wonderful dark amber color. Taste just like a pumpkin pie, but not overly spicy. Very yummy.

Poured from bomber into pint glass.  Holy Great Pumpkin Charlie Brown!  I absolutely love this beer.  My only concern while drinking is that a centurion will arrive to take back the heaven sent ambrosia.  I must go buy more immediately.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sample at the tap room. Hazy copper-amber pour with a thick light beige head that dissipates slowly. Small patches of lacing on the glass. Pumpkin and malt in the nose. Medium body with a pumpkin pie flavor with some graham cracker and malt behind it. The finish is sweet clove and pumpkin spices. Pretty good seasonal overall.

Bottle @ Home. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, fruit, pumpkin, cinnamon. Flavor is rater sweet with sweet malt, caramel, sweet fruit, spices, cinnamon. Medium body, lively carbonation. 190812

On tap at CC tasting room: I found this to be very balanced and so easy to drink. The alcohol was hidden and was very smooth going down. Im not a big fan of Pumpkin beers, but this was the best yet. Not too sweet and just yummy! I cant wait to have more.

Bottle @ FOneFan, Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2012. Unclear dark amber with big foamy tan head. Aroma is malt, cinnamon and pumpkin. Flavour is malt, pumpkin, cinnamon, hop, high carbonation, spices and a little sweet.
Bottle @ Summer Gathering, Ulfborg. Huge creamy head with excellent duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are rich pumpkin, spices, malt, caramel and hops.

Bottle 750ml @ TFODRBSG12
Pours hazy orange with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, pumpkin, cinnemon and spices. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a pumpkin spicy finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Bottle @ TFODRBSG, Ulfborg. Hazy amber with a big off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, pumpkin and spicy. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish. 180812

Bottle, 75cl, at TFODRBSG 2012. A big, light beige head forms and diminishes over an unclear, golden-orange body. Hazy. Spiced, fruity nose with a touch of caramel and pine cones. Cinnamon and all spice quite present. The flavor too is on the spiced side, with some caramel maltyness in the back, and spices up front. Pleasant bitterness all the way. Full to medium body. Quite pleasant to drink, but I suspect it will need some appropriate food to shine. 120818
Bottle. Thanks Hopscotch! Pours hazy orange witha bubbly off white head. The aroma is pumpkin, sweet caramel, spices and clove. The flavour is spicy pumpkin, cinnamon, cardemon and fruit.
Taken from old notes. Nose of pumpkin and light spices. Taste is the same with a bitter finish. Nicely blended pumpkin.

The aroma is very spicy with pumpkin, cardboard, and caramel malt. The appearance is amber with an average head. The taste is a little like the aroma but has an astringent bitterness but it is definitely a pumpkin. The mouth feel is average. Overall I like this beer but I want more pumpkin and less bitter.

750 mL courtesy of Eddie, thanks man! We got a gusher! Poured a deep copper with a huge tan head. Nose is spice, nutmeg, light vanilla, pie crust, clove, definitely pumpkin, graham cracker, and whipped cream. Taste is much the same, spice, vanilla, pumpkin, earthiness, pie crust, and ginger. Mouthfeel is medium, along with the carbonation. A pretty good beer and really just reminds me of Thanksgiving in a bottle. Cheers!

Bottle* 750ml.Hazy medium amber orange colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, spicy, pumpkin spices - clove - nutmeg - cinnamon. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, pumpkin spices - clove - nutmeg - cinnamon. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. IMO a goodbalance pumpkin beer ;O) [20120421]
Gloriously great seasonal brew. Think it was my first beer at Cigar City, and its still by far my favorite.

Poured from a bottle shared by Weihenheizen. Thanks for sharing David. Dark murky brown copper color with a faintly khaki colored head of foam. Aroma is very much pumpkin and graham crackers. Others noted a whipped cream nuance, but I couldnt find it. Cinnamon and nutmeg are hiding in the depths of this beer behind the pumpkin and graham cracker pie crust. Pretty good pumpkin beer.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2013 Refrigerated 75 cl bottle (8 oz. sample) from JoePeesie poured into white wine glass.  Pours light brown with small off-white head.  Thin small bubble lacing, medium body, and pumpkin pie aroma.  Taste is pumpkin pie (I get pumpkin, gram cracker crust, and even a hint of whip cream), cinnamon, nutmge, some clove, and finish is more pumpkin.  Good beer.  Fresh, heavily spiced and some alcohol from hopscotch 75 cl bottle.

Gorgeous dark gold color, lots of bubbles, nice lively white head.  Smells of nutmeg, all-spice, cinnamon and of course pumpkin.  Very lively mouth feel, almost fizzy.  Cardamom left on the palate.  Glad it is cold out as this a fall beer for sure.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours an orange amber with a one finger head that sticks around in my bruery tulip. Aromas of pumpkin spice, cinnamon, nutmeg, vanilla and a bit of ginger. Taste follows nose, really creamy, smooth and easy to drink. This is a great pumpkin beer, I could drink it all year!

7th April 2012ChrisOs Easter Tasting. Cheers cgarvieuk for sharing this beaut. Hazy amber beer, good cream coloured head. Smooth semi dry palate. Sweet juicy pumpkin! Nice! Mild minerally spices (nice change for a pumpkin beer - not overdone). Has a slightly minty cool aftertaste. Why more purveyors of Pumokin beers cant brew them like this is beyond me.

Bottle at Chrisos Easter tasting 2012, thanks to CGarvie. It pours hazy orange-amber, with a thick off-white head. The nose is spice, orange, pumpkin and earth. The taste is sweet pumpkin, orange, mango, spice (particularly cinnamon and nutmeg), earth, hay and straw. Medium body, moderate carbonation and foamy mouth-feel. Perhaps a bit too sweet. Not bad overall.

murky tan, large bubbled white ring dies quick. Nose is banana bread, cinnamon. Sugary flavor with more pumpkin. Tepid, under attenuated, spice offsets, YET another low carbonated sugar-water beer from ccb.

Bottle.  Orange brown pour with a thin white head.  Aroma of spices and pumpkin - nutmeg and cinnamon.  Dry spicy flavor.  Notes of chocolate and cinnamon.  Notes of clove.  Bitter hop finish.  Not bad.
Bottle at Chriso Easter Tasting 2012.  Cloudy copper. Not so spicy on the aroma more spicy on finish. Lots of cinnamon. I like cinnamon. I liked it. Good mouthfeel
Bottle. Pours deep amber. Aromas and flavor of cinnamon, pumpkin, cardamom, oatmeal. Very juicy and easy drinking pumpkin beer.

From notes. Pours a nice burnt orange with a thick off white head. 
Great aroma, roasted pumpkin, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg and clove.
Flavor keeps up with the nose. A great balance between the pumpkin and spice. I get more clove in the taste balanced by brown sugar.

I love pumpkin beers and this is no exception. Great actual pumpkin aroma and flavor along with a nice spice level. Cinnamon, nutmeg and clove go a long way here. Nice body and some sweetness. Great balance, not too sweet and has that nice pie aspect.

From notes.  First reviewed 10/22/2011.  Poured from a 750 mL bottle into a tulip. Thanks to Dunt for bringing this over.

This has a dark amber color, cloudy, with a frothy white head.

Pumpkin and spice really dominate the aroma. Some other spices in the periphery.

Some light caramel malt lead into the main attraction - strong, spiced pumpkins. Cinnamon and nutmeg are the most dominant. 

This only has a medium body despite the high ABV. There is what seems to be an off-feel to it, maybe some pumpkin residue. The finish is a little bit grainy and my mouth feels coated in plastic after my glass is done. 

There was something about this beer that struck me as off. The feel was a little bit light, and there is some pumpkin residue flavor that is not appealing to me.

My Bottom Line:
Cake-y spices and light toast ride this Pumpkin Ales expansive carbonation, creating a fun example.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-An initially creamy head of foam bobs dwindles into the cloudy amber shine.
-The mouthfeel is quite supple for a strong brew.
-Alcohol is well hidden throughout.
-Spices are well expressed in the nose, but tend to feel incohesive in the flavor profile.
-A soft hop bitterness concludes each sip.
-Malts dont offer much in the way of flavor.

Bottle. Thx Eric !

It is rare to find a spice beer with balance that isnt overwhelmed by one spice.  This is one of the few spice beers Ive had that I really enjoy.  Perfect balance of pumpkin and spices and was a real treat.

750ml bottle shared by MartinT.
Appearance : Slightly hazy amber.

Aroma : Nice big pumpkin spices with light caramel.

Taste : Spicy and a bit fruity. Pumpkin spices again but less than on the nose. Light bitterness. Some pumpkin spices on the finish with light notes of alcohol.

Palate : Carbonation felt a bit aggressive at first but settled down after 15 minutes.

Overall : Nice. Taste was slightly disappointing because the nose made you expect more pumpkin spices. Nothing bad but not my favorite pumpkin beer.

Smells of sweet cinnamon and pumpkin pie. Tastes like cold pumpkin pie and goes down easy given the high(er) ABV. Only thing this beer is missing is the whip cream flavor. Simply outstanding and I hope they do it again next year. This rivals Pumking.

Enjoyed with with family & pecan pie on Thanksgiving eve 11 Pours a nice orange with a white head. Nose and taste are of pumpkin and spices. A very solid pumpkin beer easily in my top 2 favorites. Very robust and tasty.
bottle. pours deep amber with minimal head. aroma of pie spice. taste actual roasted pumpkin with brown sugar and crust. amazing pumpkin.
Bottle: Poured a caramel color with a white head. Aroma is spicy, ginger, and pumpkin. Taste reminds me of rootbeer barrel candies with spice and nice hint of pumpkin.

Shared by turdferguson.  Pours a soft light amber with one finger of beige head.  Nose is very squashy/gourdy with a definitive bready character and pie spice.  Nutmeg and allspice.  Strong vegetable flavor. Bread dough and spice in the favor. Odd. Medium body with a spicy astringency. Light carbonation.

Bottle shared by phaleslu- thanks Peter. Pours cloudy orange with a light white head. Aroma is pumpkin, cinnamon, nutmeg and brown sugar. Flavor is nutmeg, cinnamon, pumpkin, sugar and squash. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Pretty good vegetable beer.

750 ml bottle from Michael-pollack- thanks again, pollack! Pours a cloudy orange color with a small off-white head. Aroma of cinnamon, nutmeg, brown sugar, toffee, roasted pumpkin, and nuts. Flavor of nutmeg, cinnamon, squash, soap, sugar, and sweet cookies. Medium-bodied, with medium carbonation and a spicy, soapy mouthfeel. Pretty solid pumpkin ale.

Bottle sent my way by Ksurkin.  Thanks Ken.   Cloudy orange amber with one finger yellowish white head that fades leaving minimal lace.  Let it warms up a bit to give it a fair shot as the initial smells and sips were less than favorable.  Nose still is giving off a slight wet dog smell and I am quite sure it is not my glass as I smelled it before pouring.  Getting past the wet dog there is lots of sweet pumpkin fruit, nutmeg and cinnamon.  The flavor is more bitter and tart, some dark fruits, strange yeasty (almost tastes like a belgian yeast or maybe thats just the rotting pumpkin flesh) thing.  Some light sweetness in the flavor but it doesnt mimic the nose as many beers tend to.  An interesting pumpkin ale but it didnt blow me away.

Got this bottle from Leukens. Served in a Pumking goblet.

Pours a moderate orange-copper with a good off-white head. Decent retention and some spotty lacing on the way down. The nose carried a lot of squash and pumpkin with a bit of cinnamon and miscellaneous spice in the background. The flavor didnt have quite as much spice and really focused on the squash element. Not too sweet, which was nice. Chewy medium body with moderate carbonation and a bit of spice zest in the finish. Good brew.

Another smuggled find from Keg Juggler.  Spiced pumpkin aroma and flavor. Nice palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Great pumpkin aroma that kind of reminds me of a cigar humidor. Cloudy orange color with very minimal head. A bit of bubble gum in the taste, and of course pumpkin. Smooth but oily on the palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPod Touch

One of the best pumpkin ales out there.  Second only to TREAT in my opinion.  What a perfect blend of spice and pumpkin with the backdrop of a really nice amber ale.  Tasty pleasant and not overwhelming or infected!

Orange color with a small, off white head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of cinnamon, nutmeg, caramel malts, pumpkin, and some alcohol.  Taste of cinnamon, nutmeg, caramel, and a sweeter finish.

Tap & Bottle (notes). Pour is hazy orange/amber color with a fluffy white head. Nose is pumpkin spice - cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg. Some sweet malts. Taste is pretty much the same, like eating a pumpkin pie. A great beer all around, and my personal favorite pumpkin beer.

Bottle. Bomber. Had this a few times, split one with Sean on Christmas Eve 2011. Pours a straight pumpkin orange with a thick, khaki fuzzy head. Lacing is shaving-creamy and sticky. Aroma of pumpkin, cinnamon, subtle vanilla and sugar cookie, and some very slight hints of noble hops. Medium bodied, sort of loose, with a light, somewhate lively palate. Finishes with some nice vanilla and pumpkin flavors on the tongue. Cool pumpkin ale.

Entering old rates. Draft in early phase of CCB then on draft in Oct 2010. Score reflects the updated version as the draft had lost some of its magic compared to the original smaller batch. 
Une des rares bières que javais goutées qui reprenait parfaitement le profile de la citrouille sans virer comme Southern Tier dans le faux extrait. Le tout avec les épices qui caractérisent ce type de bière automnales. On y retrouve, cannelle, girofle, all spices et une profile malté caramel qui reste en retrait pour laisser à la citrouille une belle place et une note végétale.

Pours a dark orange with thin but perfectly distributed lacing. Heavy notes of pumpkin , nutmeg, pumpkin pie and cinnamon. The palate is sweet but has a bite to it. After awhile it becomes slightly overwhelming

Poured a hazy orange. A decent dense foamy white head. Aroma is a nice blend of fall spices - nutmeg, cinnamon, etc. The flavor is more of the same but just bolder and with the added hint of pumpkin. Very creamy and tasty. This is EASILY one of my favorite pumpkin beers. Carbonation is spot on and it has a nice balanced mouthfeel. The 9% is hidden amazingly well making this very drinkable. Would LOVE to try this again sometime. Yes that is a trade offer.

Pours a light copper with a white head. Nose is ginger bread, pie crust, nutmeg, cinnamon, allspice and pumpkin. Flavor is slightly sweet pumpkin and everything the nose held. Great pumpkin beer, great balance and nothing forced.

750 ml bottle via trade with smith4498 - Pours a slightly hazy deep amber color with with a half finger thick off white head.  Very light lacing.  Aroma is big spices and toasted malt.  Flavor is much of the same.  Medium body.  As Pumpkin beers go, this one is pretty good.

Hazy amber/orange color; Medium body; Aroma of sweet malt, pumpkin, nutmeg, some vanilla, & gingerbread; Flavor of slight sweet malt, pumpkin, cinnamon, nutmeg, caramel, and spice; Nicely balanced; The alcohol is well hidden; Overall, no shortage of spices here - very good pumpkin brew.

25oz bottle picked up at HF oddly enough.  T-day beer #1.  Pours a really nice deep orange hue, big white head.  Aromas are really elegent lightly spiced, almost creamy in the nose.  Palate is super balanced, just enough spice hit up front, more nutmeg than cinnamon, but you really get a thin fleshy pumpkin in the mid, with a slightly sweeter finish.  Really solid and compared to Pumking much less boozy for the same ABV.  Well done!

750ml bottle: Pours a clear bright orange amber with a spotty-lacing off-white head.  Has a lightly sweet caramel toffee and fresh pumpkin nose with some gingerbread.  Starts with good fullness and malty sweetness with a healthy dose of pumpkin flavor and nutmeg spice with a touch of light bready notes in the finish.  Well-balanced and complex, a very enjoyable pumpkin beer.

Bomber.  Iced tea color pour with little head and lacing.  Nose had most the usual suspects such as cinnamon, nutmeg, and pumpkin.  Taste follows the nose.  This one didnt seem as artificially sweet as others which I found quite enjoyable.
750ml bottle. Poured a hazy orange color with a smaller sized head. Pumpkins, spices, vanilla, and caramel.

750 ml in trade from fishingnet. Thanks, Ben! As always. Thanksgiving Dinner choice. Pours a glowing deep amber hue, glowing edges with some sunfire, well hazed with a frothy offwhite head that laces ok, a decent sized ring. Aromas are crisp toast and caramel, vanilla and toffee, biscuits, and pumpkin puree, a bit sweeter with decent pie spice. Cinnamon, nutmeg, and more vanilla, caramel. Some crispness. Initial is medium bodied offering a touch more sweetness, vanilla and caramel blast, toffee and toast, gentle spice moves in, with cinnamon and brown sugar, toffee and biscuits. More pie spices and pumpkin puree, sweeter with carmelized malts, touches of sweetness dance, with just a hint of dryness. Fairly balanced for a sweeter beer, spice and vanilla, sweet malts. Finish is nice, gentle spice and sweetness linger. Its not complex, but its tasty, sweet slanted without being anywhere near cloying. Fairly balanced. Very nice.
